definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Taizhou has a long history, the Neolithic Age to the birth of human civilization under the Tang.
sentences.chinese: 台州歷史悠久，新石器時代就誕生下湯人類文明。

sentences.english: Recent excavations have revealed two main Neolithic cultures lying in stratified sequence.
sentences.chinese: 近年的考古發掘，主要顯示兩個新石器時代的文化層。

sentences.english: During Neolithic Period, people have already begun breeding silkworm and producing silk.
sentences.chinese: 新石器時代，蠶的養殖和絲綢的生產，就已經開始了。

sentences.english: At that time, that has entered the stage with copper and stone, a late Neolithic Age.
sentences.chinese: 說明當時已進入銅石並用階段，屬新石器時代晚期。

sentences.english: The second part is about three archeology cultures of Neolithic.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，新石器時代三種考古學文化。

sentences.english: The archaeological culture during the Neolithic Age was affected increasingly by the north of Nanling.
sentences.chinese: 新石器時代考古學文化受到來自嶺北日益強烈的影響。

sentences.english: The Orkney Islands are a neolithic site of extraordinary richness.
sentences.chinese: 奧克尼羣島是十分珍貴的新石器時代遺址。

sentences.english: Red bayberry cultivating in Majian has a long history, as early as Neolithic Age.
sentences.chinese: 馬澗楊梅，歷史悠久，早在新石器時代就有野生栽培。

sentences.english: The image of the dragon probably originated from the early Neolithic period.
sentences.chinese: 龍這種形象大約起源於新石器時代早期。

sentences.english: The archaeologists have dug up some interesting Neolithic remains.
sentences.chinese: 考古學家挖掘出一些有趣的新石器時代的遺蹟。

sentences.english: Jade Cong plays an important role in the jade articles from the Neolithic Age.
sentences.chinese: 在新石器時代出土玉器種類中，玉琮佔有一席之地。

sentences.english: In the Neolithic far, Kongquehe human activities have on the basin.
sentences.chinese: 遠在新石器時代，孔雀河流域就已有人類活動。

sentences.english: They call it the Neolithic Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 這些書裏稱它爲新石器革命。

sentences.english: Considering that the source of the mythological animals with wings and squamae can trace to forepart of New Stone Age.
sentences.chinese: 認爲帶翼神獸之淵源確可上溯到中國早期新石器時期。

sentences.english: Tea culture was inferentially traceable to Sichuan at the middle or late Neolithic Age.
sentences.chinese: 茶文化是在我國新石器時代中期或晚期起源於巴蜀。

definition: the Bronze Age/also written 青銅時代|青铜时代[Qing1 tong2 Shi2 dai4]
Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
Dawenkou culture (c. 4100-2600 BC), Neolithic culture based in today's Shandong area 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
Qijia neolithic culture, centered around the Gansu Corridor 河西走廊[He2 xi1 Zou3 lang2] c. 2000 BC
ancient hominid species such as Homo erectus, Neanderthal man etc
